column1: 4104740820,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-data-analyst-at-scalapay-4104740820?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=SO5FGrzkuTdPjSJa1zy9TA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You‚Äôll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

L‚ÄôOpen Banking √® il nostro DNA!


Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 √® una realt√† indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments
column2: we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

column1: Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.
üöÄ Join us as Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

As a Data Analyst, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Development teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.
Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product and business line through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios.

Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.

Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments
column2:
we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will join the Tech &
column3:
Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Development teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission

  • Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product and business line through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
  • Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
  • Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
  • Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
  • Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
  • Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
  • Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Your Ideal Profile

  • Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios.
  • Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
  • Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
  • Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FztS4IxfRCRcjuEGTYDD%2BA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4121361232,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-visualization-at-sky-italia-4121361232?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=44JgC7i4fPGWhyyDL%2FQ%2Baw%3D%3D,Data Visualization,Sky Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About the job
As a visualisation data engineer manager,
You will design and deliver reporting solutions of excellent quality leveraging data from our new cloud platform while meeting business expectations

You‚Äôll develop your career and be responsible for the creation of clear, reliable and informative dashboards while taking an active role helping us define what good looks like in our visualisation capability.
You will explore a large amount of data and analyze complex phenomena that impact the Sky business
You will interact will business stakeholders understanding the need and proposing the best approach to data representation
You will join an agile team, whose main scope is to drive the of Sky‚Äôs transformation into a modern Data Driven Company
You will be part of a major International Data Hub
Be part of the Data Visualization Practice within the Data Platform team, mentoring and coaching other members of the team
Manage, monitor and develop the data visualization platform in terms of licenses and organizational definition, interacting with Sky group and local teams
Work within an international team for the management of data visualization services

Proactively identify opportunities to improve and rationalise applications and processes across all squads within the team, working in close collaboration with other team members and subject matter experts
Continuously implement, promote and improve our ways of working, defining best practice, frameworks and processes

Co-work with colleagues of other business units with different backgrounds, cultures and roles to design innovative solutions, contributing with a deep domain knowledge and highlighting opportunities, risks and challenges
Work closely with Data Custodians and Data Governance experts to achieve high data quality standards
Work as a key member within a squad - understand and contribute to the agile delivery process and take ownership for your team‚Äôs software quality from concept to production
Drive forward the production of reusable code and modules where appropriate with a view to maximising effort and reducing development costs by applying principles of Agile delivery
At least five years experience on Tableau or similar visualisation tools in complex business projects
Proven experience working with large, complex datasets in a cloud environment.
At least five years experience on SQL applied to enterprise grade projects
Extensive data analysis and interpretation background to critically evaluate data gathered from various sources, helping key partners understand and maximise the potential of data
Self-motivator with energy and drive for continuous improvement and a focus on delivering results
Proven ability to influence technical decisions in a fast-moving commercial environment
Demonstrates exceptional communication and social skills and has a demonstrable ability to influence technical decisions in a fast paced commercial environment
Attitude to act as a business translator to address with a faster pace analytic requirement, keeping high quality standards
Ability to 'think outside the box' to come up with pragmatic solutions to de-risks and solve issues
Ability to adapt to technological and business priority changes
Lean and/or Agile practice is appreciated
Data Governance principles knowledge is appreciated
Proven experience on cloud-based solutions is appreciated
Experience on Python, R or equivalent query languages will be a plus
If you‚Äôre ready to work in a dynamic environment alongside talented people who take pride in delivering great results, apply today.

About the job

As a visualisation data engineer manager,

  • You will design and deliver reporting solutions of excellent quality leveraging data from our new cloud platform while meeting business expectations
  • You‚Äôll develop your career and be responsible for the creation of clear, reliable and informative dashboards while taking an active role helping us define what good looks like in our visualisation capability.
  • You will explore a large amount of data and analyze complex phenomena that impact the Sky business
  • You will interact will business stakeholders understanding the need and proposing the best approach to data representation
  • You will join an agile team, whose main scope is to drive the of Sky‚Äôs transformation into a modern Data Driven Company
  • You will be part of a major International Data Hub



What You'll Do


  • Be part of the Data Visualization Practice within the Data Platform team, mentoring and coaching other members of the team
  • Manage, monitor and develop the data visualization platform in terms of licenses and organizational definition, interacting with Sky group and local teams
  • Work within an international team for the management of data visualization services
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve and rationalise applications and processes across all squads within the team, working in close collaboration with other team members and subject matter experts
  • Continuously implement, promote and improve our ways of working, defining best practice, frameworks and processes
  • Co-work with colleagues of other business units with different backgrounds, cultures and roles to design innovative solutions, contributing with a deep domain knowledge and highlighting opportunities, risks and challenges

Work closely with Data Custodians and Data Governance experts to achieve high data quality standards

  • Work as a key member within a squad - understand and contribute to the agile delivery process and take ownership for your team‚Äôs software quality from concept to production
  • Drive forward the production of reusable code and modules where appropriate with a view to maximising effort and reducing development costs by applying principles of Agile delivery


Your skills:


  • At least five years experience on Tableau or similar visualisation tools in complex business projects
  • Proven experience working with large, complex datasets in a cloud environment.
  • At least five years experience on SQL applied to enterprise grade projects
  • Extensive data analysis and interpretation background to critically evaluate data gathered from various sources, helping key partners understand and maximise the potential of data
  • Self-motivator with energy and drive for continuous improvement and a focus on delivering results
  • Proven ability to influence technical decisions in a fast-moving commercial environment
  • Demonstrates exceptional communication and social skills and has a demonstrable ability to influence technical decisions in a fast paced commercial environment
  • Attitude to act as a business translator to address with a faster pace analytic requirement, keeping high quality standards
  • Ability to 'think outside the box' to come up with pragmatic solutions to de-risks and solve issues
  • Ability to adapt to technological and business priority changes
  • Lean and/or Agile practice is appreciated
  • Data Governance principles knowledge is appreciated
  • Proven experience on cloud-based solutions is appreciated
  • Experience on Python, R or equivalent query languages will be a plus


If you‚Äôre ready to work in a dynamic environment alongside talented people who take pride in delivering great results, apply today.

4066731390,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/crm-data-analyst-at-compass-banca-s-p-a-gruppo-mediobanca-4066731390?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=gp6I77%2F9%2Fs%2F860MsC9EMgg%3D%3D,CRM Data Analyst,Compass Banca S.p.A. - Gruppo Mediobanca,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Ricerchiamo una giovane e brillante risorsa dall‚Äôottimo curriculum accademico, laureata in discipline economico/statistiche con 1-2 anni di esperienza in posizioni analoghe.

l candidato prescelto verr√† inserito nella Direzione Centrale Marketing e Innovation all‚Äôinterno dell‚ÄôUfficio CRM e Reporting e svolger√† analisi sul portafoglio clienti, misurer√† le performance di campagne marketing, si occuper√† di costruire/manutenere modelli di scoring e forecasting, ottimizzare processi di real time di marketing automation, di migliorare il presidio del territorio attraverso modelli geostatistici.

Il candidato ideale vanta un‚Äôottima conoscenza di SAS o di strumenti similari per l‚Äôanalisi e la modellizzazione dei dati, di strumenti di Data Visualization/BI, dei modelli di propensione ed esperienza in data mining.

Deve essere persona dotata di mentalit√† analitica e critica, abituata a lavorare con i numeri, portata allo studio ed alla valutazione dei dati ma anche in grado di mantenere sempre una pi√π ampia visione d‚Äôinsieme, abile nel saper condividere e presentare risultati, lavorando in team.
Deve essere curiosa, precisa, affidabile, motivata e brava nella gestione del tempo e dello stress.

Ricerchiamo una giovane e brillante risorsa dall‚Äôottimo curriculum accademico, laureata in discipline economico/statistiche con 1-2 anni di esperienza in posizioni analoghe.


l candidato prescelto verr√† inserito nella Direzione Centrale Marketing e Innovation all‚Äôinterno dell‚ÄôUfficio CRM e Reporting e svolger√† analisi sul portafoglio clienti, misurer√† le performance di campagne marketing, si occuper√† di costruire/manutenere modelli di scoring e forecasting, ottimizzare processi di real time di marketing automation, di migliorare il presidio del territorio attraverso modelli geostatistici.


Il candidato ideale vanta un‚Äôottima conoscenza di SAS o di strumenti similari per l‚Äôanalisi e la modellizzazione dei dati, di strumenti di Data Visualization/BI, dei modelli di propensione ed esperienza in data mining.


Deve essere persona dotata di mentalit√† analitica e critica, abituata a lavorare con i numeri, portata allo studio ed alla valutazione dei dati ma anche in grado di mantenere sempre una pi√π ampia visione d‚Äôinsieme, abile nel saper condividere e presentare risultati, lavorando in team.

Deve essere curiosa, precisa, affidabile, motivata e brava nella gestione del tempo e dello stress.

Mooney ricerca per la propria sede di Milano un Fraud Data Analyst esperto e motivato da inserire nel nostro team di Analytics Fraud Intelligence, dedicato alla prevenzione e gestione delle frodi.

La risorsa sar√† responsabile dell'analisi dei dati, della rilevazione di pattern sospetti e dello sviluppo di soluzioni data-driven per mitigare i rischi di frode, contribuendo alla sicurezza e affidabilit√† delle nostre operazioni
Il/la candidato/a si occuper√† delle seguenti attivit√†:
Analizzare grandi volumi di dati transazionali e comportamentali per individuare anomalie e potenziali frodi.

Collaborare con team interni (Risk Management, IT, Legal) per progettare strumenti e processi di prevenzione della frode.

Esperienza minima di 3 anni come Data Analyst/Data Scientist o in un ruolo analogo, preferibilmente in ambito frode o rischio.
Esperienza con piattaforme di pagamento elettronico e digital wallet.
Competenze avanzate nell‚Äôuso di strumenti di analisi dati (ad esempio SQL, Python, R).
Esperienza con strumenti di visualizzazione dati come Power BI, Tableau o similari.
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e modellazione predittiva.

Competenza avanzata nell'utilizzo del pacchetto Microsoft Office, con particolare enfasi su Excel per l'analisi dei dati, inclusi l'uso di funzioni avanzate, tabelle pivot, macro, e strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati.
Esperienza nella creazione di report dettagliati Power Point e dashboard interattive.
Forte capacit√† di problem solving e attenzione ai dettagli.
Conoscenza delle normative e dei regolamenti relativi alla sicurezza dei pagamenti elettronici.
Ottime capacit√† comunicative e di presentazione.
Capacit√† di lavorare sotto pressione e gestire pi√π priorit√† contemporaneamente.

We are looking for

We are looking for a driven and enthusiastic Data Analyst (m/w/d) , who desires to contribute to the growth and success of our Product Team.

Your role in BizAway

  • You manage and improve our current reporting system, supporting all internal needs for Data visualization of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make our data understandable.
  • You learn all aspects of the travel industry from Finance, Products, Sales and Service/Operations perspective, translating data into actionable insights resulting in verifiable reporting.
  • By having domain expertise in our industry, you engage with Business and Strategy stakeholders to help define KPIs, including how data will be captured, shared, and leveraged across our departments.
  • You contribute to creating the base foundations of a comprehensive source of truth through data modeling actions

Your Basic Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience with BI Data Visualization tools (Qlik preferred)
  • Data analysis, presentation, and visualization experience
  • Strong communication skills required
  • Ability to work alone or in a team as required
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field is preferred
  • Confidence in English (written and spoken level B2).

We are also interested in

  • Experience with ETL tools (AWS Glue, Airflow, Talend)
  • Understanding of machine learning concepts
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

At TrueLayer, we're building the future of payments. We're on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today's online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce ‚Äî the payment ‚Äî we're making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we've raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we're trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We're reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We're transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what's possible with technology and innovation. Now, we're looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.
TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we'll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.
What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:
Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements
Build and maintain data models for key business use cases, through DBT
Drive the collection and integration of new and existing data sources
Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business
Help cultivate a data-driven culture by providing TrueLayeristas with the knowledge and tools required to self-serve
Relevant experience that aligns with the key requirements of the role, demonstrating a proven ability to contribute effectively and drive results.
Experience in using Git for end-to-end deployment in production workloads
Experience working with cloud platforms, such as AWS or GCP
Experience with data orchestration tools, such as Apache Airflow or AWS Step Functions
Proficiency in SQL for data modelling
Experience with data visualisation, and familiarity with self-serve tools such as QuickSight, Looker or Tableau
Familiarity with business metrics such as conversion rates, CAC, CSAT, LTV, MRR and experience working with business teams to define and maintain KPIs
The ability to communicate effectively, simply, and clearly - you can present insights to technical and non-technical audiences, and you love proposing actionable solutions
Self-sufficiency, the ability to motivate yourself and manage your own priorities and time
A passion for bringing fresh ideas to the table, and drive things forward without needing direction
We'd be particularly excited if you have
Experience using DBT (cloud or core) for data modelling in production workflows
Previous experience at a startup or high-growth company in FinTech or Payments
Working knowledge of machine learning methodology and algorithms (including Python packages)
What you can expect from us:
Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company üí∞
Flexible hours and very flexible hybrid/remote working within Italy
A one-off contribution of ‚Ç¨200 to help you set up your home office üí∫
Flexible holiday policy, with 24 days as standard ‚úàÔ∏è
2 volunteering days to support causes important to you üå≥
Generous parental leave, above and beyond statutory requirements and with no minimum tenure üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüë¶
Meal vouchers for every day you're working, including while remote [IT Roles Only]
Budget to spend on learning & development each year üìö
12 fully-paid wellbeing days a year and your birthday off (on top of the holiday allowance) üïä
Membership of mental wellbeing platform Spill üßò

At TrueLayer, we don't just do inclusion and diversity. We embrace people that have different opinions, perspectives and personalities. Because we believe that by seeing the world from all sorts of angles, we can make life better for all the people who live in it. We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented groups (e.g. people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from all socio-economic backgrounds). If you'd like to discuss alternative working patterns, please let us know.

We will always aim to make appropriate adjustments to ensure we are fully inclusive to people with different needs during our interview process. So if you need us to make any adjustments to suit your individual needs please let us know - we'll be happy to support you.

Who we are:

At TrueLayer, we're building the future of payments. We're on a mission to take on outdated payment methods with a solution designed for today's online, on-demand economy. By removing friction at the heart of commerce ‚Äî the payment ‚Äî we're making it faster, safer, and smarter for everyone.

To date, we've raised $300 million from world-renowned investors including Stripe, Tiger Global, Addition, and Tencent. With offices in London, Milan, and Dublin, we're trusted by industry leaders like RyanAir and JustEat Takeaway. But this is just the beginning.

We're reimagining how the world pays, invests, shops, and saves. We're transforming payments for industries like e-Commerce and iGaming, redefining what's possible with technology and innovation. Now, we're looking for people who are ready to help us build a brand that changes an industry.

Description

TrueLayer's new Analytics team empowers our entire organisation to make strategic decisions based on a scalable data infrastructure, coupled with commercial insight and impeccable leadership skills.

A Data Analyst at TrueLayer works in cross-functional teams and partners with stakeholders across the company, including Growth, Client Care, Engineering and Product, to unlock the power of data and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spend your time building datasets, conducting analysis and sharing learnings with teams.

In return, we'll empower our Data Analysts to own Analytics planning, and make key decisions around data infrastructure and analytics best practices. Working in an exciting and growing team of Analysts, Data Engineers and an Analytics Lead, your analysis and insight will be the fuel that drives our journey to power the new era of financial innovation globally.

What we expect from you as a Data Analyst:

  • Collaborate with business teams such as Commercial, Product, Client Care, Engineering and Operations to understand and help define their analytics requirements
  • Build and maintain data models for key business use cases, through DBT
  • Drive the collection and integration of new and existing data sources
  • Be a BI subject matter expert, conduct deep analyses and communicate insights to the business
  • Help cultivate a data-driven culture by providing TrueLayeristas with the knowledge and tools required to self-serve

Who you are

  • Relevant experience that aligns with the key requirements of the role, demonstrating a proven ability to contribute effectively and drive results.
  • Experience in using Git for end-to-end deployment in production workloads
  • Experience working with cloud platforms, such as AWS or GCP
  • Experience with data orchestration tools, such as Apache Airflow or AWS Step Functions
  • Proficiency in SQL for data modelling
  • Experience with data visualisation, and familiarity with self-serve tools such as QuickSight, Looker or Tableau
  • Familiarity with business metrics such as conversion rates, CAC, CSAT, LTV, MRR and experience working with business teams to define and maintain KPIs
  • The ability to communicate effectively, simply, and clearly - you can present insights to technical and non-technical audiences, and you love proposing actionable solutions
  • Self-sufficiency, the ability to motivate yourself and manage your own priorities and time
  • A passion for bringing fresh ideas to the table, and drive things forward without needing direction

We'd be particularly excited if you have

  • Experience using DBT (cloud or core) for data modelling in production workflows
  • Previous experience at a startup or high-growth company in FinTech or Payments
  • Working knowledge of machine learning methodology and algorithms (including Python packages)

Benefits

What you can expect from us:

  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity in the company üí∞
  • Flexible hours and very flexible hybrid/remote working within Italy
  • A one-off contribution of ‚Ç¨200 to help you set up your home office üí∫
  • Flexible holiday policy, with 24 days as standard ‚úàÔ∏è
  • 2 volunteering days to support causes important to you üå≥
  • Generous parental leave, above and beyond statutory requirements and with no minimum tenure üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüë¶
  • Meal vouchers for every day you're working, including while remote [IT Roles Only]
  • Budget to spend on learning &

Never stop learning: formazione continua per tutto l‚Äôarco della carriera con 80 ore di training iniziale e successiva attivit√† di coaching e mentoring. Valutazioni semestrali del potenziale e della performance.
Ambiente internazionale e giovane: et√† media inferiore a 30 anni, possibilit√† di trasferte anche all‚Äôestero.

SDG opera in Italia con 4 uffici (Milano, Firenze, Verona e Roma) e dislocamenti in Spagna, Portogallo, Francia, UK, USA e Middle East. 4135272054,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-match-digital-4135272054?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=bwuMg1PUB9ezskRp0WkbpQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Match Digital,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Data Science Analyst
Milan (2 days per week in the office)
Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.

With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.
Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.
We‚Äôre hiring for a Data Science Analyst to join the Data & Business Intelligence team.
This role will support with the implementation of data science innovation projects that lead to an improvement in customer experience and economic value for the business and its partners.
Reporting to a Data Scientist, this role will support with the scale up and roll out of AI and big data led innovation projects.
As Data Science Analyst, you will:
Develop new Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning based products.
Collect and prepare data for various international projects.
Ensure data quality and consistency pre and post release.
Upgrade advanced analytical models while maintaining business continuity.
Scale analytical solutions from pilot to production for partner brands.
Provide support for advanced analytical solutions.
Experience as a Data Analyst or Data Science Analyst with a focus on big data and / or data science projects.
Knowledge of data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, SQL, and R.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, communication, and English language skills.
Experience working with dislocated teams in a global, multicultural environment.
Up to 35 days holiday and paid leave per year
Agile working model ‚Äì ability to work remotely 3 days per week.
Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Competitive salary + 10% bonus + benefits

  • Ensure data quality and consistency pre and post release.
  • Upgrade advanced analytical models while maintaining business continuity.
  • Scale analytical solutions from pilot to production for partner brands.
  • Provide support for advanced analytical solutions.


To apply, you should have


  • Experience as a Data Analyst or Data Science Analyst with a focus on big data and / or data science projects.
  • Knowledge of data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, SQL, and R.
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, communication, and English language skills.
  • Experience working with dislocated teams in a global, multicultural environment.


The perks


  • Restaurant ticket
  • Mobile phone (iPhone or Samsung)
  • Up to 35 days holiday and paid leave per year
  • Agile working model ‚Äì ability to work remotely 3 days per week.
  • Home office IT equipment.
  • Health insurance (Fondo est).
  • Pension plan and parental leave


Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Are you an automotive fan? Do you have experience in the world of data analysis and enjoy providing the best solutions for customers? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our team in Rome or Milan.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support the data management and analysis processes within the organization. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes.
Collaborate with teams to identify business needs and data requirements
Create reports, and conduct analyses regarding trainings
Applying the procedures in compliance with the company's standards and policies

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Junior Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT, Statistics or similar experience, as well as:
Advanced level user of Power BI, HTML, Cornerstone, MS Office (especially Excel)
Fully professional Italian and English knowledge
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
If you can demonstrate that you are familiar with data analysis and reporting and you are a team-player, we would like to hear from you!

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In joining MSX, you can enjoy:
You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

Junior Data Analyst

40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

Rome / Milan, hybrid


Are you an automotive fan? Do you have experience in the world of data analysis and enjoy providing the best solutions for customers? MSXI has the job for you!


MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our team in Rome or Milan.



The Role

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support the data management and analysis processes within the organization. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes.


Your key tasks will be:

  • Collaborate with teams to identify business needs and data requirements
  • Create reports, and conduct analyses regarding trainings
  • Applying the procedures in compliance with the company's standards and policies


About you

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Junior Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT, Statistics or similar experience, as well as:


  • Experience in reporting, data analysis
  • Advanced level user of Power BI, HTML, Cornerstone, MS Office (especially Excel)
  • Fully professional Italian and English knowledge
  • Great problem-solving and communication skills
  • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities


If you can demonstrate that you are familiar with data analysis and reporting and you are a team-player, we would like to hear from you!


What‚Äôs in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.


In joining MSX, you can enjoy:

  • Competitive salary
  • Company laptop and phone
  • Lunch voucher


Working pattern:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Monday ‚Äì Friday, 9 am to 6 pm
  • Rome or Milan - hybrid


You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. Monitorare i principali KPI e KQI mediante report periodici.

Ottima conoscenza di SQL ed R.
Conoscenza di Python e di almeno una piattaforma di Data visualization (PowerBI, Looker, Tableau).
Accuratezza, pensiero analitico e razionale, capacit√† di sintesi.
Capacit√† di lavorare sia in modo autonomo che in team.

Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

La risorsa sar√† inserita all‚Äôinterno del gruppo analitico nell‚Äôarea Marketing e si occuper√† di:

  • Monitorare i principali KPI e KQI mediante report periodici.
  • Misurare l‚Äôefficacia delle campagne di marketing in termini quantitativi e qualitativi mediante analisi mirate.
  • Supportare l‚Äôapproccio data-driven per lo sviluppo di nuove campagne e l‚Äôindividuazione di nuovi cluster profittevoli.
  • Contribuire al data preparation.
  • Collaborare alla qualit√† del dato.


Requirements

Laurea in discipline STEM.

Pregressa esperienza analitica, preferibilmente in ambito finanziario.

Ottima conoscenza di SQL ed R.

Conoscenza di Python e di almeno una piattaforma di Data visualization (PowerBI, Looker, Tableau).

Ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office.

Completano Il Profilo

  • Visione architetturale del dato.
  • Accuratezza, pensiero analitico e razionale, capacit√† di sintesi.
  • Time management e organizzazione.
  • Capacit√† di lavorare sia in modo autonomo che in team.
  • Attitudine alla condivisione del know-how.
  • Adattabilit√†, entusiasmo e curiosit√†.


Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

4135506784,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-tui-4135506784?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=t4ojGNg%2F4ncizgfFPH7XCA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,TUI,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Joining the TUI Musement Data Science & Analytics Team as a‚ÄØData Analyst, you will be providing support to the business experts in TUI Musement in the definition of the requirements for the Data team. You will join a team that will have as its main objective to use TUI data sets and combine it with external data streams to create additional and innovative value for business development, process optimization and a more personalized digital service delivery.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

TUI Musement, or TUI MM for short, is the world‚Äôs leading provider of destination experiences. With 9,000 diverse employees in 49 countries and head office locations including Palma de Mallorca, Luton and Hannover. We offer 14 million guests a portfolio of excursions, activities, tours, transfers and guest services. TUI MM is part of TUI Group, the world's leading tourism group.‚ÄØ
Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!
Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.
Liaise with IT to develop a joint data-led ecosystem to provide Descriptive & Predictive data insights.‚ÄØ
Liaise with business units to understand business needs, perform in-deep analysis to design data solutions to drive decisions made on data products.‚ÄØ
Contribute to the strategic definition of the tool‚Äôs ecosystem needed for a data-led business.‚ÄØ
Collaborate actively with the team that will correctly drive the automation of all the current manual data reporting solutions.‚ÄØ
Collaborate with the team that manages all the Data Integrations (from a functional perspective).‚ÄØ
Drive a cultural change to help TUI Musement in its data-led and digital transformation.‚ÄØ
Contribute to the design and implementation of data solutions (integration + quality check + visualization).‚ÄØ
Explore data visualization techniques for best UX across the business.‚ÄØ
Contribute to the effective communication to both internal and external stakeholders of the current data and analytics solutions and future analytics roadmap for TUI Musement.‚ÄØ

A Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field or working experience of the same is also acceptable for the position. Business-oriented education is also valuable.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

The candidate must have proven and successful experience and a track record of participating in Business Intelligence and Business Analytics projects in large organizations with relevant complexity. Tourism sector expertise is not mandatory but will be highly valued.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
High level of attention to detail, concern about data quality, and excellent execution. Skilled to contribute as a team player and an individual.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Ability to manage multiple tasks and conflicting priorities without losing focus on planning.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Problem-solving skills and systems thinking is highly valuable.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Expertise in visualization / dashboarding techniques and tools ‚Äì expertise in Power BI / Tableau or other related tool is necessary.‚ÄØ
Trustworthy and committed professional, exceptional at dealing with ambiguity within a global perspective.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Passion for learning without fear of failure in a passionate and agile team.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excellent communicator, both verbal and written, in English. Comfortable communicating high level concepts to senior stakeholders whilst also being able to delve into the detail of complex changes when required.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.
We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

3-5 anni di esperienza nel ruolo Data Analyst o Data Engineer in progetti di medie dimensioni.

4137755973,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-insights-analytics-specialist-at-astrazeneca-4137755973?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2BscvC%2B7pJOQuA7iOVbEuQQ%3D%3D,Business Insights & Analytics Specialist,AstraZeneca,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, reporting to the Business Insight & Analytics Head within AstraZeneca Oncology Business Unit, you will act as the reference point for the cross-functional team within the therapeutic area, managing all activities related to business insights and analytics. Your mission will be to critically interpret data and transform it into strategic business recommendations that drive decision-making, fostering a data-driven culture.

This role requires a deep understanding of customer insights and advanced business analytics. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring that all strategic initiatives are guided by robust data analysis and interpretation, enabling AstraZeneca to anticipate market trends and meet evolving business needs.
As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, you will be responsible for:

Serve as the primary point of reference for all market research and customer insights activities within the therapeutic area, transforming complex data into strategic insights that will inform and guide business decision

Collaborate with the cross-functional team as well as external vendors to design projects that address business needs, supporting both current and future portfolio, while keeping in mind the evolution of the healthcare context in which we operate through horizon scanning activities

Develop medium and long-term strategic forecasts for AZ Oncology marketed products and pipeline that incorporate disease epidemiology, evolving treatment paradigms, competitive products, pricing and access dynamics - collaborating closely with the cross-functional team and Finance Dept - ensuring that forecast models are informed by the latest data available
Lead performance monitoring to help internal stakeholders stay informed by providing strategic insights for the business
Strategic data generation, analysis and reporting:

Collect data and information related to AZ Oncology products and competitors to support business growth as well as transform data and insights into business recommendations, communicating them to various stakeholders at different levels
Develop expertise in the analysis and interpretation of diverse data sets, converting them into actionable reports, dashboards and tools, to enable effective decision-making across the organization

Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and global/regional I&A teams to evaluate market opportunities thorough data assessment (ie. competitive landscape, market potential, HCP insights etc) to advise and support strategic plans
You will manage all activities and relationships in accordance with company values, code of conduct, internal procedures, and Italian legislation.
3-4 years of experience in Business Intelligence or Business Insights or Market Analysis or Finance
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Proven analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Strong influencing skills to provide guidance to peers and seniors
Proficiency in written and spoken English

4136578704,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/commercial-data-analyst-milan-madrid-or-warsaw-at-boston-scientific-4136578704?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=tq1qJ4VRh%2FNKpGh9rEYTEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=XdvncjgeCjS9ruNrIrXkQA%3D%3D,"Commercial Data Analyst - Milan, Madrid or Warsaw",Boston Scientific,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Additional Locations: Spain-Madrid
column2: Poland-Warsaw

column1: Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance

At Boston Scientific, we‚Äôll give you the opportunity to harness all that‚Äôs within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we‚Äôll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you‚Äôll be supported in progressing ‚Äì whatever your ambitions.

We are seeking a passionate and motivated Data Analytics professional to join our EMEA Capital Equipment and Services. This position will provide an invaluable opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the field of data analytics, working on meaningful projects that directly impact our operations and business strategies.
In This Job, You Will Be Responsible To
Create effective visualizations and dashboards using tools like Tableau to communicate key insights to internal stakeholders.
Maintain and update already existing dashboards.
Collect, clean, and analyze data from the data sources available in the company.
Automatize project workflows such as the automatization of report updates and extraction of databases used for reports.
Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines to ensure data integrity and availability.
Work with other functional teams to understand their data needs and provide effective analytical solutions.
What Are We Looking For In You
Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics or a related technical bachelor degree.
Fluency in English is a must.
Demonstrated proficiency in advanced programming languages, such as Python, Matlab or C++. Experience performing statistical analysis, data modeling, and task automatization.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus.
Experience working with advanced functions, formulas, pivot tables, and data manipulation techniques in Excel.
Ability to work independently and in a team, with strong communication skills.
Capacity to handle multiple tasks and priorities in a dynamic environment.
Self-motivated with a great initiative attitude, pragmatic and hard worker.
Full-time role with a dedicated mentor and development opportunities.
Working within an international, proactive and innovative environment.
Upskilling in a challenging but healthy competition atmosphere.
Mentoring and a company investing in the professional and personal development of its people.
In our offices either in Madrid, Milan or Warsaw, on a hybrid working schedule.

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most ‚Äì united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do ‚Äì as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn‚Äôt just business, it‚Äôs personal. And if you‚Äôre a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

column2:
Poland-Warsaw

Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance

At Boston Scientific, we‚Äôll give you the opportunity to harness all that‚Äôs within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we‚Äôll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you‚Äôll be supported in progressing ‚Äì whatever your ambitions.

About The Role

We are seeking a passionate and motivated Data Analytics professional to join our EMEA Capital Equipment and Services. This position will provide an invaluable opportunity to gain hands-on experience in the field of data analytics, working on meaningful projects that directly impact our operations and business strategies.

In This Job, You Will Be Responsible To

  • Create effective visualizations and dashboards using tools like Tableau to communicate key insights to internal stakeholders.
  • Maintain and update already existing dashboards.
  • Collect, clean, and analyze data from the data sources available in the company.
  • Automatize project workflows such as the automatization of report updates and extraction of databases used for reports.
  • Assist in the development and maintenance of data pipelines to ensure data integrity and availability.
  • Work with other functional teams to understand their data needs and provide effective analytical solutions.
  • Monitor service profitability.
  • Develop/update deal guidelines/tools.
  • Support deal structuring.
  • Structure incentive schemes.

What Are We Looking For In You

  • Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics or a related technical bachelor degree.
  • Fluency in English is a must.
  • Strong analytical and technical skills.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in advanced programming languages, such as Python, Matlab or C++. Experience performing statistical analysis, data modeling, and task automatization.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus.
  • SAP knowledge is welcome.
  • Experience working with advanced functions, formulas, pivot tables, and data manipulation techniques in Excel.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team, with strong communication skills.
  • Capacity to handle multiple tasks and priorities in a dynamic environment.
  • Self-motivated with a great initiative attitude, pragmatic and hard worker.

What Can We Offer You

  • Full-time role with a dedicated mentor and development opportunities.
  • Hybrid working schedule.
  • Working within an international, proactive and innovative environment.
  • Upskilling in a challenging but healthy competition atmosphere.
  • Mentoring and a company investing in the professional and personal development of its people.
  • Company with a purposeful mission.

Location:

In our offices either in Madrid, Milan or Warsaw, on a hybrid working schedule.

Requisition ID: 599036

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most ‚Äì united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do ‚Äì as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.

The Business Intelligence and Strategy Senior Specialist, Partner Territories is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of business data to help drive strategic decisions within the organization. This role requires a deep understanding of data analysis, business operations, and strategic planning, with the ability to deliver smart Strategic Business presentation to senior leadership to support business growth and optimization

column2: conduct SWOT analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) and competitive analysis to help guide decision-making, with a regional focus

column2: support Business Development Senior Manager in NSOs business cases.

Stay up to date with the latest BI tools, industry best practices, and market conditions to drive continuous improvement in BI capabilities
work closely with Analytics team on reports and dashboards using data visualization tools (i.e. Power BI).
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure that business strategies align with operational capabilities and market realities.
Identify inefficiencies or areas for optimization within business processes and recommend data-driven improvements.

This role combines both the technical expertise of Business Intelligence with strategic thinking and business acumen, making it integral to shaping an organization‚Äôs future direction based on data insights.

Good communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to various stakeholders.
Curious, open-minded and focus on team success, high attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving
Willingness to learn and to always share knowledge

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

Valorizziamo l‚Äôunicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.¬†

Il nostro approccio alla diversit√† e all‚Äôinclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.¬†
Promuoviamo l‚Äôinserimento e l‚Äôintegrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette ‚Äì in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99¬†¬†
Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

4137755973,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-insights-analytics-specialist-at-astrazeneca-4137755973?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=is2zIVs8AVEbn1EeZfWT3w%3D%3D&trackingId=21MadS7ENW5%2FczOdccwQrA%3D%3D,Business Insights & Analytics Specialist,AstraZeneca,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, reporting to the Business Insight & Analytics Head within AstraZeneca Oncology Business Unit, you will act as the reference point for the cross-functional team within the therapeutic area, managing all activities related to business insights and analytics. Your mission will be to critically interpret data and transform it into strategic business recommendations that drive decision-making, fostering a data-driven culture.

This role requires a deep understanding of customer insights and advanced business analytics. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring that all strategic initiatives are guided by robust data analysis and interpretation, enabling AstraZeneca to anticipate market trends and meet evolving business needs.
As a Business Insights & Analytics Specialist, you will be responsible for:

Serve as the primary point of reference for all market research and customer insights activities within the therapeutic area, transforming complex data into strategic insights that will inform and guide business decision

Collaborate with the cross-functional team as well as external vendors to design projects that address business needs, supporting both current and future portfolio, while keeping in mind the evolution of the healthcare context in which we operate through horizon scanning activities

Develop medium and long-term strategic forecasts for AZ Oncology marketed products and pipeline that incorporate disease epidemiology, evolving treatment paradigms, competitive products, pricing and access dynamics - collaborating closely with the cross-functional team and Finance Dept - ensuring that forecast models are informed by the latest data available
Lead performance monitoring to help internal stakeholders stay informed by providing strategic insights for the business
Strategic data generation, analysis and reporting:

Collect data and information related to AZ Oncology products and competitors to support business growth as well as transform data and insights into business recommendations, communicating them to various stakeholders at different levels
Develop expertise in the analysis and interpretation of diverse data sets, converting them into actionable reports, dashboards and tools, to enable effective decision-making across the organization

Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and global/regional I&A teams to evaluate market opportunities thorough data assessment (ie. competitive landscape, market potential, HCP insights etc) to advise and support strategic plans
You will manage all activities and relationships in accordance with company values, code of conduct, internal procedures, and Italian legislation.
3-4 years of experience in Business Intelligence or Business Insights or Market Analysis or Finance
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Experience in a Healthcare Company or market research industry or Healthcare Consultancy
Proven analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Strong influencing skills to provide guidance to peers and seniors
Proficiency in written and spoken English

You will join a team that will have as its main objective to use TUI data sets and combine it with external data streams to create additional and innovative value for business development, process optimization and a more personalized digital service delivery.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

TUI Musement, or TUI MM for short, is the world‚Äôs leading provider of destination experiences. With 9,000 diverse employees in 49 countries and head office locations including Palma de Mallorca, Luton and Hannover. We offer 14 million guests a portfolio of excursions, activities, tours, transfers and guest services. TUI MM is part of TUI Group, the world's leading tourism group.‚ÄØ
Become part of our team - applications open! This role will be advertised for a minimum of 14 days but could close anytime after this time so don't delay!
Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, bonus opportunity, exclusive travel perks & discounts, extensive health & wellbeing support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer hybrid or remote working models.
A career to shape: Opportunities to upskill, reskill and grow your career. Access the TUI Tech Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Expand your horizons: Participate in our tech communities and collaborate on global projects and teams.
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation and the Sustainable Tech Community.
Liaise with IT to develop a joint data-led ecosystem to provide Descriptive & Predictive data insights.‚ÄØ
Liaise with business units to understand business needs, perform in-deep analysis to design data solutions to drive decisions made on data products.‚ÄØ
Contribute to the strategic definition of the tool‚Äôs ecosystem needed for a data-led business.‚ÄØ
Collaborate actively with the team that will correctly drive the automation of all the current manual data reporting solutions.‚ÄØ
Collaborate with the team that manages all the Data Integrations (from a functional perspective).‚ÄØ
Drive a cultural change to help TUI Musement in its data-led and digital transformation.‚ÄØ
Contribute to the design and implementation of data solutions (integration + quality check + visualization).‚ÄØ
Explore data visualization techniques for best UX across the business.‚ÄØ
Contribute to the effective communication to both internal and external stakeholders of the current data and analytics solutions and future analytics roadmap for TUI Musement.‚ÄØ

A Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field or working experience of the same is also acceptable for the position. Business-oriented education is also valuable.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

The candidate must have proven and successful experience and a track record of participating in Business Intelligence and Business Analytics projects in large organizations with relevant complexity. Tourism sector expertise is not mandatory but will be highly valued.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
High level of attention to detail, concern about data quality, and excellent execution. Skilled to contribute as a team player and an individual.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Ability to manage multiple tasks and conflicting priorities without losing focus on planning.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Problem-solving skills and systems thinking is highly valuable.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Expertise in visualization / dashboarding techniques and tools ‚Äì expertise in Power BI / Tableau or other related tool is necessary.‚ÄØ
Trustworthy and committed professional, exceptional at dealing with ambiguity within a global perspective.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Passion for learning without fear of failure in a passionate and agile team.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Excellent communicator, both verbal and written, in English. Comfortable communicating high level concepts to senior stakeholders whilst also being able to delve into the detail of complex changes when required.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.
We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

work closely with Analytics team on reports and dashboards using data visualization tools (i.e. Power BI).
