Identify inefficiencies or areas for optimization within business processes and recommend data-driven improvements.

This role combines both the technical expertise of Business Intelligence with strategic thinking and business acumen, making it integral to shaping an organization‚Äôs future direction based on data insights.

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Le posizioni aperte riguardano profili sia junior che senior.

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

4136127666,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-business-intelligence-analyst-at-ridemovi-4136127666?position=7&pageNum=5&refId=LktsDpiQ1nL%2BdWd2LDqR6w%3D%3D&trackingId=sCO0B0E8Zv45k%2BHW2JbYIw%3D%3D,Senior Business Intelligence Analyst,RideMovi,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","üåü We‚Äôre Hiring: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote)

We are a leading European micro-mobility company revolutionizing urban transportation through sustainable and data-driven solutions. Our mission is to make cities smarter and greener while optimizing efficiency and user experiences. We‚Äôre looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst with strong expertise in Tableau, SQL and user segmentation strategies to help us refine our pricing approach and enhance operational performance.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will lead data-driven initiatives to optimize our pricing strategies and improve CRM and operational workflows. Leveraging tools like Tableau and SQL, you‚Äôll analyze user data, identify clusters, and develop actionable strategies that maximize revenue while enhancing customer satisfaction.
Pricing Strategy: Analyze user clusters and purchasing behavior to define pricing strategies tailored to diverse customer segments.
User Segmentation: Develop and refine data-driven user clusters based on behavioral, geographical, and transactional data.
Data Visualization: Create interactive Tableau dashboards that communicate key insights and track the impact of pricing and operational changes.
Operational Efficiency: Use data analysis to identify bottlenecks and recommend process improvements to optimize workflows.
CRM Optimization: Collaborate with CRM and Marketing teams to enhance customer engagement and retention strategies through data insights.
Write and optimize SQL queries to extract, analyze, and transform large datasets for both ad hoc and long-term analyses.
Define and monitor KPIs to evaluate pricing adjustments and user segmentation initiatives.
Partner with stakeholders across Operations, Marketing, and Product to drive actionable, data-informed decisions.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
2‚Äì3 years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analysis, with a focus on pricing strategies, user segmentation, or similar areas.
Advanced skills in Tableau for creating impactful data visualizations.
Strong SQL expertise for querying, manipulating, and analyzing large datasets.
Experience in customer segmentation, predictive modeling, or cluster analysis techniques.
Solid understanding of CRM tools and lifecycle analytics.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to present insights clearly to technical and non-technical audiences.
A passion for sustainability and urban mobility is a strong plus.
Mission-Driven Impact: Be part of a team dedicated to transforming urban transportation and driving sustainability.
Meal vouchers provided as part of your benefits package.
Opportunities for continuous learning, professional development, and growth.
Competitive salary and benefits, including bonuses, mobility service discounts, and more.

If you‚Äôre excited about using Tableau, SQL, and advanced analytics to shape pricing strategies and optimize user experiences, we want to hear from you! Apply now by sending your CV through LinkedIn Easy Apply.

üåü We‚Äôre Hiring: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote)

üìç Location: Milan

üö≤ Industry: Micro-Mobility and Urban Innovation

üìÑ Contract Type: Full-Time

Language Requirement: Italian (Mandatory), English (Mandatory)


About Us

We are a leading European micro-mobility company revolutionizing urban transportation through sustainable and data-driven solutions. Our mission is to make cities smarter and greener while optimizing efficiency and user experiences. We‚Äôre looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst with strong expertise in Tableau, SQL and user segmentation strategies to help us refine our pricing approach and enhance operational performance.


Your Role

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will lead data-driven initiatives to optimize our pricing strategies and improve CRM and operational workflows. Leveraging tools like Tableau and SQL, you‚Äôll analyze user data, identify clusters, and develop actionable strategies that maximize revenue while enhancing customer satisfaction.


Key responsabilities:

  • Pricing Strategy: Analyze user clusters and purchasing behavior to define pricing strategies tailored to diverse customer segments.
  • User Segmentation: Develop and refine data-driven user clusters based on behavioral, geographical, and transactional data.
  • Data Visualization: Create interactive Tableau dashboards that communicate key insights and track the impact of pricing and operational changes.
  • Operational Efficiency: Use data analysis to identify bottlenecks and recommend process improvements to optimize workflows.
  • CRM Optimization: Collaborate with CRM and Marketing teams to enhance customer engagement and retention strategies through data insights.
  • Write and optimize SQL queries to extract, analyze, and transform large datasets for both ad hoc and long-term analyses.
  • Define and monitor KPIs to evaluate pricing adjustments and user segmentation initiatives.
  • Partner with stakeholders across Operations, Marketing, and Product to drive actionable, data-informed decisions.


What we're looking for

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 2‚Äì3 years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analysis, with a focus on pricing strategies, user segmentation, or similar areas.
  • Advanced skills in Tableau for creating impactful data visualizations.
  • Strong SQL expertise for querying, manipulating, and analyzing large datasets.
  • Experience in customer segmentation, predictive modeling, or cluster analysis techniques.
  • Solid understanding of CRM tools and lifecycle analytics.
  • Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills to present insights clearly to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • A passion for sustainability and urban mobility is a strong plus.


What we offer

  • Mission-Driven Impact: Be part of a team dedicated to transforming urban transportation and driving sustainability.
  • Meal vouchers provided as part of your benefits package.
  • Opportunities for continuous learning, professional development, and growth.
  • Competitive salary and benefits, including bonuses, mobility service discounts, and more.


Ready to Apply?

If you‚Äôre excited about using Tableau, SQL, and advanced analytics to shape pricing strategies and optimize user experiences, we want to hear from you! Apply now by sending your CV through LinkedIn Easy Apply.

4092104731,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-at-laco-4092104731?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=bDwyGIjgr7TMfeMvDdhdFg%3D%3D&trackingId=SvL6wSsRnswYGkkIdxiLvQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Power BI,LACO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.

LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.

At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.
As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:
Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.
You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶
You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
We‚Äôre open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶
Don‚Äôt let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.


LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.


At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:

  • Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
  • Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
  • Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS

  • You have a Bachelor‚Äôs and/or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have an analytical mindset.
  • You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
  • You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
  • You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
  • You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.


You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶

  • You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
  • You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
  • You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER

  • We‚Äôre open to work with Employees and Freelancers
  • Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶


Don‚Äôt let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

4133392784,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-gentis-4133392784?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=bDwyGIjgr7TMfeMvDdhdFg%3D%3D&trackingId=KkUrGXwy8fx2pbSYxwXInA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Gentis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"We are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our dynamic and solution-oriented team. In this role, you will be the crucial link between the business and operational services, supporting key departments such as sales, claims, underwriting, and product development. Variety will be your daily reality, with opportunities to contribute across diverse areas like implementing AI solutions, supporting pricing strategies, and providing actionable insights.
Support the business by answering complex quantitative questions and delivering clear, actionable insights.
Monitor and analyze product portfolios to identify trends and improvement opportunities.
Collaborate with stakeholders to support product development and pricing exercises.
Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance performance across departments.
Coach and train colleagues to strengthen their analytical capabilities.
Is fluent in English and has a strong knowledge of Dutch or French, with a good understanding of the other language.
Knowledge of Qlik or similar data visualization tools.
Has advanced expertise in Microsoft Excel, with little left to learn in the tool.
Holds a degree in fields like Business Administration, Business Economics, Business Engineering, or an equivalent qualification through experience.
Has a passion for numbers and the ability to explain complex analyses to non-experts.
Tackles challenges proactively and learns from every experience.
Combines pragmatism, openness to feedback, and a critical yet positive mindset.
Can work independently but thrives in a team-oriented, self-steered environment.
An interest in AI, machine learning, or advanced analytics techniques.
A varied and dynamic role within a supportive team.
A modern workspace with flexible working arrangements, including remote work options.
A full-time, permanent contract with competitive compensation and fringe benefits.
Additional vacation days to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
Opportunities for continuous learning and personal development.

If you‚Äôre ready to take initiative, contribute to impactful projects, and join a team that values collaboration and innovation, we‚Äôre eager to meet you. Apply now and be part of a company where your well-being and professional growth are top priorities.

We are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our dynamic and solution-oriented team. In this role, you will be the crucial link between the business and operational services, supporting key departments such as sales, claims, underwriting, and product development. Variety will be your daily reality, with opportunities to contribute across diverse areas like implementing AI solutions, supporting pricing strategies, and providing actionable insights.


What Will You Do?

Your Strengths

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in insurance.

What We Offer

  • A varied and dynamic role within a supportive team.
  • A modern workspace with flexible working arrangements, including remote work options.
  • A full-time, permanent contract with competitive compensation and fringe benefits.
  • Additional vacation days to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
  • Opportunities for continuous learning and personal development.


If you‚Äôre ready to take initiative, contribute to impactful projects, and join a team that values collaboration and innovation, we‚Äôre eager to meet you. Apply now and be part of a company where your well-being and professional growth are top priorities.

4124981692,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-at-alohi-4124981692?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=B63nHat0A%2B9%2BP%2BGKZF9wZg%3D%3D&trackingId=NA6eu8NSTjz0Q%2F1WF%2BCpFg%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst,Alohi,"Plan-les-Ouates, Geneva, Switzerland","Alohi SA, headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, brings together a highly competent team that focuses on merging state-of-the-art technologies with compelling user experience to simplify and enhance life for companies and people worldwide. The company provides Sign.Plus (a legally binding electronic signature), Fax.Plus (online faxing), and Scan.Plus (AI-powered mobile scanner) to over 4,000,000 customers worldwide.

At Alohi, we began our journey with an initial seed investment from Fongit ""Fondation Genevoise pour l'Innovation Technologique"" which is backed by the state of Geneva. But instead of relying on external funding to fuel our growth, we've chosen to bootstrap our way to success. This approach has allowed us to prioritize our customers and build products that truly meet their needs, without being beholden to outside investors. By remaining financially independent, we've been able to maintain our autonomy and agility, which have been key factors in our ability to innovate and stay ahead of the curve.

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. As a Data Analyst at Alohi, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making. You will craft effective intelligent benchmarks, understand performance, care about data quality, enable automation and create visualizations and stories that help drive our business.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize key business questions and objectives
Design and implement data collection systems and processes to ensure accuracy and completeness of data
Work with SQL and other data tools to extract, clean, transform and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis data from various sources
Clean, transform, and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis
Analyze complex datasets using statistical techniques and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and correlations in the data to derive meaningful insights
Integrate and utilize AI tools like OpenAI API to develop and implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for data-driven insights
Assist in designing experiments (A/B tests) and analyze the results to inform product development and marketing strategies
Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
Monitor and evaluate the performance of data-driven initiatives and provide recommendations for improvements
Support ad-hoc data analysis requests from different departments to inform strategic decisions
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science
Minimum 4 years experience as a Data Analyst or similar role
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets
Proficient in SQL and experience working with relational databases
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python
Experience with data visualization tools such as Metabase, Tableau and Power BI
Experience using OpenAI API or similar AI tools, specifically with implementing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience with ETL processes and data integration
In addition to the technical skills, you will need:
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualizations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work within deadlines

Alohi SA, headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, brings together a highly competent team that focuses on merging state-of-the-art technologies with compelling user experience to simplify and enhance life for companies and people worldwide. The company provides Sign.Plus (a legally binding electronic signature), Fax.Plus (online faxing), and Scan.Plus (AI-powered mobile scanner) to over 4,000,000 customers worldwide.

At Alohi, we began our journey with an initial seed investment from Fongit ""Fondation Genevoise pour l'Innovation Technologique"" which is backed by the state of Geneva. But instead of relying on external funding to fuel our growth, we've chosen to bootstrap our way to success. This approach has allowed us to prioritize our customers and build products that truly meet their needs, without being beholden to outside investors. By remaining financially independent, we've been able to maintain our autonomy and agility, which have been key factors in our ability to innovate and stay ahead of the curve.

Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. As a Data Analyst at Alohi, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making. You will craft effective intelligent benchmarks, understand performance, care about data quality, enable automation and create visualizations and stories that help drive our business.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize key business questions and objectives
  • Design and implement data collection systems and processes to ensure accuracy and completeness of data
  • Work with SQL and other data tools to extract, clean, transform and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis data from various sources
  • Clean, transform, and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis
  • Analyze complex datasets using statistical techniques and data visualization tools to identify patterns, trends, and correlations in the data to derive meaningful insights
  • Integrate and utilize AI tools like OpenAI API to develop and implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for data-driven insights
  • Assist in designing experiments (A/B tests) and analyze the results to inform product development and marketing strategies
  • Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
  • Monitor and evaluate the performance of data-driven initiatives and provide recommendations for improvements
  • Support ad-hoc data analysis requests from different departments to inform strategic decisions


Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science
  • Minimum 4 years experience as a Data Analyst or similar role
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets
  • Proficient in SQL and experience working with relational databases
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Metabase, Tableau and Power BI
  • Experience using OpenAI API or similar AI tools, specifically with implementing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
  • Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Experience with ETL processes and data integration

In addition to the technical skills, you will need:

  • Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualizations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
  • Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work within deadlines
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business models and the underlying analytics, and the ability to assimilate new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, be vocally self-critical, and with an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. They recognize that the true measure of the work product is the business impact it has.

In this role, you will work closely with the operations teams to provide data and analytical support for Sort Center initiatives, root cause investigation of defects, and will provide support to insure compliance to operational-related SOX requirements. Moreover, analyze data to support Operational Excellence initiatives, dig deep into data to determine root cause of defects, build and maintain decision support tools, and present findings to business partners to drive improvements in Fulfillment Center-wide quality and productivity.

The complexity of research and skills for the position is well beyond basic data entry and research. It involves complex analysis and diving deep into key metrics based on requests, building and maintaining multiple databases, extensive knowledge of software applications to create tools, and understanding of multiple programming languages. The following provides some detail of the job duties and responsibilities.
Development of data collection processes and data management systems
Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
Designing of queries, compiling of data, and generation of reports in MS Access and Excel
Charting and graphing of data for reporting purposes
In depth research of defect trends
Data collection and entry as needed
1+ years of data analysis and formula creation in Microsoft Excel experience
1+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role and conducting analysis and data mining using Excel
1+ years‚Äô experience extracting and processing data using SQL.
Demonstrated experience pulling and analyzing data to aid in root cause identification and drive process improvement initiatives across the network

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business models and the underlying analytics, and the ability to assimilate new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, be vocally self-critical, and with an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. They recognize that the true measure of the work product is the business impact it has.

In this role, you will work closely with the operations teams to provide data and analytical support for Sort Center initiatives, root cause investigation of defects, and will provide support to insure compliance to operational-related SOX requirements. Moreover, analyze data to support Operational Excellence initiatives, dig deep into data to determine root cause of defects, build and maintain decision support tools, and present findings to business partners to drive improvements in Fulfillment Center-wide quality and productivity.

The complexity of research and skills for the position is well beyond basic data entry and research. It involves complex analysis and diving deep into key metrics based on requests, building and maintaining multiple databases, extensive knowledge of software applications to create tools, and understanding of multiple programming languages. The following provides some detail of the job duties and responsibilities.

Key job responsibilities

  • Development of data collection processes and data management systems
  • Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
  • Designing of queries, compiling of data, and generation of reports in MS Access and Excel
  • Charting and graphing of data for reporting purposes
  • In depth research of defect trends
  • Data collection and entry as needed
  • Data mining and problem solving

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • 1+ years of data analysis and formula creation in Microsoft Excel experience
  • 1+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role and conducting analysis and data mining using Excel
  • 1+ years‚Äô experience extracting and processing data using SQL.
  • Demonstrated experience pulling and analyzing data to aid in root cause identification and drive process improvement initiatives across the network

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with end-to-end project management

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Servicios Comerciales Amazon Mexico S. de R.L. de C.V.

4134288060,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-news-partnerships-compliance-operations-at-google-4134288060?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=B63nHat0A%2B9%2BP%2BGKZF9wZg%3D%3D&trackingId=c40uFogZVbUKiwrgsu0leQ%3D%3D,"Data Analyst, News Partnerships, Compliance Operations",Google,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: London, UK
column2: Z√ºrich, Switzerland
column3: Madrid, Spain.Minimum qualifications:

column1: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Quantitative Science, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience working in data analytics, consulting, data science, engineering, or a technical operations role.
3 years of experience in statistical problem solving and analyzing data sets using SQL or comparable coding languages (e.g., Python, R, Java, C++).
Experience in analyzing data using spreadsheet software or building data pipelines and automated workflows.
Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, etc.).
2 years of experience with designing experiments, developing statistical models, measurement, and identifying business opportunities.
Experience in data analysis, with the ability to solve problems in complex, fluid, and ambiguous business environments through data intuition and business acumen.
Experience influencing senior leadership on analytical decision making.
Knowledge of Google tools (e.g., Plex, BQ, etc.).
Ability to effectively communicate analysis and recommendations across a wide range of non-technical audiences.

Google's leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges, and members of BizOps work in small teams to find solutions. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis, and then zoom out to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives, roll-up your sleeves to help drive implementation and check back-in to see the impact of your recommendations.

As a data analyst, you will partner with the News Partnerships team and its leadership to provide data-driven insights into the compliance operating processes, practices and programs across the organization.
You will play a critical role in designing data that supports our approach to regulation in key markets, influences outcomes with strategic partners, and drives favorable outcomes for Google.

The Global Partnerships organization is responsible for exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Google‚Äôs Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The Global Partnerships team supports Google‚Äôs own Product teams with essential partnerships to help Google‚Äôs user experiences in advertising, Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping, Payments and more. Teams create product-enabling partnerships, go-to-market strategies and incubate business growth for a variety of products.
Use data to conduct data-oriented analysis, architect metrics, synthesize information, solve problems, and influence business decision-making by presenting insights and market trends.
Design and implement various integrations between business objectives and design and build strategies that support these business systems.
Conduct strategic analysis, optimize business performance, and deliver execution within product and function.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

About The Job

Google's leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges, and members of BizOps work in small teams to find solutions. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis, and then zoom out to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives, roll-up your sleeves to help drive implementation and check back-in to see the impact of your recommendations.

As a data analyst, you will partner with the News Partnerships team and its leadership to provide data-driven insights into the compliance operating processes, practices and programs across the organization.

You will play a critical role in designing data that supports our approach to regulation in key markets, influences outcomes with strategic partners, and drives favorable outcomes for Google.

The Global Partnerships organization is responsible for exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Google‚Äôs Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The Global Partnerships team supports Google‚Äôs own Product teams with essential partnerships to help Google‚Äôs user experiences in advertising, Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping, Payments and more. Teams create product-enabling partnerships, go-to-market strategies and incubate business growth for a variety of products.

Responsibilities

  • Use data to conduct data-oriented analysis, architect metrics, synthesize information, solve problems, and influence business decision-making by presenting insights and market trends.
  • Design and implement various integrations between business objectives and design and build strategies that support these business systems.
  • Conduct strategic analysis, optimize business performance, and deliver execution within product and function.

For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.
Provide cross functional analysis and design powerful visualizations to support our stakeholders in making strategic decisions.
Develop standards and tools to enhance automation of reports and connections to/from them.
Design, Create, Implement, And Maintain Reporting And Tools By
Coordinating with other data analyst/data scientist/IT teams to lead common projects and drive best practice solutions that are aligned company wide
Collecting, monitoring, and analyzing data to identify areas of improvements, risks, and business changes
Maintaining databases and tools, and performing updates as necessary to ensure accuracy
Developing new tools to continuously improve process efficiency and integrate new business requirements
Collecting cross-functional analysis & reporting needs, department tools and opportunities for standardization and automation of processes.
Designing, producing, enhancing reports, dashboards and tools for the Integrated Business Planning function including Inventory Management
Helping to drive critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports
Providing suggestions based on findings that might be utilized to inform business strategies
Providing an on-going presence ‚Äòon the ground‚Äô to help end users leverage the tools and available training
Being the first ‚Äúline of support‚Äù when an issue arises
Education level: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or a related discipline
Strong technical and analytical skills. Aptitude for problem solving and for turning data inputs into relevant information
High degree of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and VBA
Strong SQL and SAP BI skills are highly desirable
Power Query, DataIku, MS Azure, MS Access, Python would be a strong plus
What Is Required For This Position
Efficient time management, priority setting, and capacity to meet deadlines
Attention to detail and accuracy, curiosity, and a mindset of continuous learning and improvement
Passionate team player with ability to take ownership and accountability for tasks
Fluent in reading, speaking, and writing in English, with French a strong plus

Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education &
column2:
Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.

Provide cross functional analysis and design powerful visualizations to support our stakeholders in making strategic decisions.

Develop standards and tools to enhance automation of reports and connections to/from them.

Design, Create, Implement, And Maintain Reporting And Tools By

  • Coordinating with other data analyst/data scientist/IT teams to lead common projects and drive best practice solutions that are aligned company wide
  • Collecting, monitoring, and analyzing data to identify areas of improvements, risks, and business changes
  • Maintaining databases and tools, and performing updates as necessary to ensure accuracy
  • Developing new tools to continuously improve process efficiency and integrate new business requirements
  • Collecting cross-functional analysis &
column3:
reporting needs, department tools and opportunities for standardization and automation of processes.
  • Designing, producing, enhancing reports, dashboards and tools for the Integrated Business Planning function including Inventory Management
  • Helping to drive critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports
  • Providing suggestions based on findings that might be utilized to inform business strategies
  • Providing an on-going presence ‚Äòon the ground‚Äô to help end users leverage the tools and available training
  • Being the first ‚Äúline of support‚Äù when an issue arises

    Experience, Skills &
column4:
Knowledge

  • Education level: Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or a related discipline
  • Strong technical and analytical skills. Aptitude for problem solving and for turning data inputs into relevant information
  • High degree of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and VBA
  • Strong SQL and SAP BI skills are highly desirable
  • Power Query, DataIku, MS Azure, MS Access, Python would be a strong plus

What Is Required For This Position

  • Efficient time management, priority setting, and capacity to meet deadlines

  • Fluent in reading, speaking, and writing in English, with French a strong plus

4137030754,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analysis-intern-imersis-at-newwave-telecom-technologies-inc-4137030754?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=B63nHat0A%2B9%2BP%2BGKZF9wZg%3D%3D&trackingId=eP%2BydEqN0Hyu4vDBWVpsDw%3D%3D,Data Analysis Intern - Imersis,"NewWave Telecom & Technologies, Inc.","Fully, Valais, Switzerland","Job Type

NewWave is a people first corporation who has been widely recognized for putting our social responsibility at the very heart of everything we do. For employees the NewWave experience is one of enrichment, challenge, and growth. Our culture is centered on recognizing our people come first, embracing a growth mindset, striving for excellence, and driving the greater good.

Imersis is a cloud-based, data quality tool, designed to help state Medicaid agencies prepare Transformed Medicaid Statistical Information System (T-MSIS) data for advanced analytics and to meet federal requirements. This position will help an emerging Python/SQL Developer hone their skills while supporting the continued advancement of the Imersis system. Interns will be considered for full time positions as Jr. Data Engineers long term.
What We Need You To Do
Write/edit calculations using Python Pyspark from high level specifications that will evaluate data quality of T-MSIS data
Write/edit SQL Warehouse and Databricks Catalog queries for data visualizations in Apache Superset
Run ETL pipelines in Databricks to test T-MSIS Data Quality
Communicate with our testing partners to identify, triage, and fix bugs and errors in both the back end and front end of the application
What We Need you to Bring:
Must be ""Data-minded"", brings examples of showing analytical skills to organize and manipulate large amounts of data
Skills That Would Set You Apart
Knowledge/experience in healthcare, especially claims experience
Skills We Will Provide As Part Of This Internship
Candidates will be subject to a background check.
Must have lived in the United States at least 3 out of the last 5 years.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication, and organizational skills - must be able to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing.
Must be able to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environment with varying priorities, based on a team building culture.

NewWave is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. NewWave is a proud Veteran friendly employer.

Job Type

Part-time, Internship

Description

WHY NEWWAVE?

NewWave is a people first corporation who has been widely recognized for putting our social responsibility at the very heart of everything we do. For employees the NewWave experience is one of enrichment, challenge, and growth. Our culture is centered on recognizing our people come first, embracing a growth mindset, striving for excellence, and driving the greater good.

Position Summary

Imersis is a cloud-based, data quality tool, designed to help state Medicaid agencies prepare Transformed Medicaid Statistical Information System (T-MSIS) data for advanced analytics and to meet federal requirements. This position will help an emerging Python/SQL Developer hone their skills while supporting the continued advancement of the Imersis system. Interns will be considered for full time positions as Jr. Data Engineers long term.

What We Need You To Do

  • Write/edit calculations using Python Pyspark from high level specifications that will evaluate data quality of T-MSIS data
  • Write/edit SQL Warehouse and Databricks Catalog queries for data visualizations in Apache Superset
  • Run ETL pipelines in Databricks to test T-MSIS Data Quality
  • Communicate with our testing partners to identify, triage, and fix bugs and errors in both the back end and front end of the application

Requirements

What We Need you to Bring:

  • Experience with Python, SQL
  • Must be ""Data-minded"", brings examples of showing analytical skills to organize and manipulate large amounts of data

Skills That Would Set You Apart

  • Pyspark, SQL Warehouse
  • Knowledge/experience in healthcare, especially claims experience
  • Experience working in Databricks
  • Git experience

Skills We Will Provide As Part Of This Internship

  • T-MSIS data structures
  • Working with Protected Health Information (PHI)
  • Diverse database loading/extraction skills
  • Constructing ETL pipelines

Our Clients And Teammates Require

  • Candidates will be subject to a background check.
  • Must have lived in the United States at least 3 out of the last 5 years.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication, and organizational skills - must be able to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing.
  • Must be able to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environment with varying priorities, based on a team building culture.

NewWave is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. NewWave is a proud Veteran friendly employer.

Salary Description

$15-20/Hour

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do ‚Äì but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here ‚Äì we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.
Are you passionate about customer success?

Caterpillar provides services to our customers far beyond the initial equipment sale. We leverage connected equipment and our decades of application expertise to enhance customer performance. Cat Digital exists to support enterprise efforts to deliver value-added services to customers. By enhancing customer value, Caterpillar and our dealers create the opportunity to profitably grow our businesses while reducing the impact of market cycles.

Services is where we are investing our time, talent and money because they drive value for our customers, our company and our dealers. If you have a passion for helping customers succeed and want to be part of growing services, now is a great time to join.

This is a fixed-term contract for 12 months for the position of Business Intelligence Analyst in the Service Backlog Team within the Cat Digital division. The Service Backlog Team‚Äôs mission is to deliver qualitative service leads through our digital application to our internal customers (industries and dealers) to drive services revenue through our digital product.

As the Business Intelligence Analyst , your responsibility will be to leverage various datasets and develop/sustain services leads. You will also participate in specific projects aiming at further strengthening the service leads ecosystem. The position involves collaborating closely with team members, explaining lead management analytics to customers with limited data knowledge, and interacting with Data Engineers on technical details. The role also includes transforming data into service recommendations through creative approaches.
Gather and implement business requirements for service leads development
Analyze feedback information to improve leads quality
Provide recommendations to internal partners based on quantitative and qualitative data
Improvement, enhancement and development of specific dataset based on opportunities
Drive processes improvement and automation of service lead generation application
Master or bachelor's degree in Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, or Business administration.

4117236448,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-at-bvlgari-4117236448?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=B63nHat0A%2B9%2BP%2BGKZF9wZg%3D%3D&trackingId=s%2Fd4PoiRcPHUV%2FmlW%2BXV2g%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst,Bvlgari,"Neuch√¢tel, Neuch√¢tel, Switzerland","In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next :

As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.

You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.
Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.
Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.
Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.

With a Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.

You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.
As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.
Fluency in both French and English is mandatory
column2: knowledge of Italian is a plus.

column1:
In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next :


Senior Data Analyst


As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.


You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.


Job responsibilities

  • Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.


  • Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
  • Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.


  • Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.


  • Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.


  • Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
  • Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.


Profile

With a Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.


You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.


As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.


Fluency in both French and English is mandatory
column2: knowledge of Italian is a plus.

EMEA Analytics Specialists team is tasked with supporting the EMEA account teams in a diverse number of ways, ranging from answering tenders, running approach workshops, customizing demos and building prototypes to directly supporting customers with specific requests. At this center we are looking for individuals who are willing to take on the challenge of building excellent product knowledge, collaborating with product management group, conceptualizing it into a solution in the area of Analytics (BI, DWH, AI, ML) and combining this with a good commercial sense while working in an international environment.

As an analytics specialist you get to work on the latest product offerings be it in the cloud or on premise in the field of Oracle Analytics. It provides the chance to develop on a very broad spectrum, ranging from product/ solution expertise, customer interaction, communication and general IT market knowledge. Successful analytics specialists are in high demand and have the opportunity to pursue a career path both in presales and in many different IT and non-IT functions.
Accelerate customer opportunities with new and existing customers through technical presentations, workshops, solution assistance, or hands-on assistance and demonstrations
Answer Requests for Information and Requests for Proposal as part of our Solution Assistance offering (Product Questions, Architecture and Infrastructure Questions)
Assist in the creation of customized analytics demos
Proactively support account teams in positioning Analytics as a key differentiator for either cloud or on-premise solutions.
Maintain in depth and up to date knowledge of relevant business drivers & typical customer needs as well as market and industry trends
Ensure collaboration with product management group as well as fellow colleagues on account engineering teams, cloud adoption managers, ISV presales teams.

At Oracle, we don‚Äôt just respect differences‚Äîwe celebrate them. 4120833284,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-researcher-at-nicoll-curtin-4120833284?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=B63nHat0A%2B9%2BP%2BGKZF9wZg%3D%3D&trackingId=iKSu6BPN7JXj1HMjsk86SA%3D%3D,Quantitative Researcher,Nicoll Curtin,"Zurich, Switzerland","Are you an experienced Quant Engineer with a passion for Systematic Trading? Do you have strong software development skills in Python, R, C# or F#? Are you keen to contribute to the growth of a successful Hedge Fund? If so this could be the perfect Quant Engineer job for you.

You will be joining a close knit team that are responsible for performing Quant analytics for the firm's Portfolio Managers. The team operate in a hybrid technology and Quant capacity given the firm are a Systematic Trading Firm. The core of the role is analysing Options market data to truly understand how a market works and build automated trading strategies around this. So the role will be a blend of developing and improving operational processes by ensuring they are more automated, working as the layer between the technology team and the portfolio managers, performing data analysis of very large data sets and creating trading strategies.

The group has expanded rapidly, which provides numerous technical challenges and the opportunity for a clear career trajectory either deeper in Quantitave Analysis or alternatively into the trading / portfolio management space. This is a unique opportunity to be a key part of a successful Hedge Fund and get to learn from real expert Traders / Portfolio Managers.

The team are hiring multiple levels of experience. Quants with strong programming skills and a keen interest in learning about Trading will be considered and similarly candidates with excellent knowledge of Quantitative Analysis and multiple years of experience will also be considered. What is essential is a good technical background in a programming language such as Python, R, C#, or F#. Excellent numerical and analytical skills, Excel skills and an interest in Options / Systematic Trading.

The firm focus on Options and Volatility trading, as such any interest or experience with Volatility and Equity Derivatives would be highly beneficial - however proven Quant experience in any asset class will be considered, provided you can demonstrate a true enthusiasm to work within the Systematic Trading space.

If you are interested in this Quant Engineer job and want to find out more please send me an updated version of your CV to yves.amar@nicollcurtin.com, if you do not have an updated version of your CV and would like to find out more, then please give me a call on 044 5785 330

4102983907,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-researcher-equity-stat-arb-at-winston-fox-4102983907?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=B63nHat0A%2B9%2BP%2BGKZF9wZg%3D%3D&trackingId=fHal%2FhMZ3vVG%2Fv5vl5JuZQ%3D%3D,"Quantitative Researcher, Equity Stat-Arb",Winston Fox,"Zug, Switzerland","This client is a senior portfolio manager with a long and successful track record at some of the world's top hedge funds at scale. This Manager has recently joined a new large fund in Switzerland and seeks to build a new team. This manager is focused on developing and deploying cutting-edge trading strategies across global markets. This manager 'genuinely' operates at the intersection of finance, data science, and technology, and he is entirely hands-on. Join a team of brilliant minds in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where your contributions will make a real impact.

We seek a talented and driven quantitative alpha researcher with equity statistical arbitrage strategies expertise. The ideal candidate will combine deep market knowledge with advanced quantitative skills to design, backtest, and implement innovative trading models. Proficiency in Python is essential, as you'll work extensively with data-driven research and algorithmic strategy development.
Develop and refine statistical arbitrage strategies focused on equity markets.
Conduct rigorous data analysis to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and alpha opportunities.
Build and maintain robust backtesting frameworks to evaluate strategy performance.
Collaborate with data engineers to source, clean, and preprocess large datasets.
Optimize strategies for execution, considering market impact, slippage, and risk constraints.
Monitor live strategy performance and adjust as necessary to maintain alpha generation.
Master‚Äôs/PhD. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Probability Theory, Machine Learning, etc
Excellent understanding and experience of equity markets and statistical techniques.
Proven experience in quantitative research and strategy development. 3-7 years of experience.
Proficiency in Python, with experience in libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, and PyTorch (or similar).
Solid understanding of machine learning and statistical modeling techniques.
Good understanding of risk management principles and portfolio optimization.
Fluency in verbal and written English.
Aggressive compensation package, including top-line performance-based bonuses. Full benefits package.
A culture of innovation and collaboration in a supportive team environment.
Access to cutting-edge technology and data resources and significant capital.
Opportunities for professional development and growth. Strong potential to progress to running and managing risk in the future.

This client is a senior portfolio manager with a long and successful track record at some of the world's top hedge funds at scale. This Manager has recently joined a new large fund in Switzerland and seeks to build a new team. This manager is focused on developing and deploying cutting-edge trading strategies across global markets. This manager 'genuinely' operates at the intersection of finance, data science, and technology, and he is entirely hands-on. Join a team of brilliant minds in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where your contributions will make a real impact.


Role

We seek a talented and driven quantitative alpha researcher with equity statistical arbitrage strategies expertise. The ideal candidate will combine deep market knowledge with advanced quantitative skills to design, backtest, and implement innovative trading models. Proficiency in Python is essential, as you'll work extensively with data-driven research and algorithmic strategy development.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and refine statistical arbitrage strategies focused on equity markets.
  • Conduct rigorous data analysis to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and alpha opportunities.
  • Build and maintain robust backtesting frameworks to evaluate strategy performance.
  • Collaborate with data engineers to source, clean, and preprocess large datasets.
  • Optimize strategies for execution, considering market impact, slippage, and risk constraints.
  • Monitor live strategy performance and adjust as necessary to maintain alpha generation.


Qualifications

  • Master‚Äôs/PhD. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Probability Theory, Machine Learning, etc
  • Excellent understanding and experience of equity markets and statistical techniques.
  • Proven experience in quantitative research and strategy development. 3-7 years of experience.
  • Proficiency in Python, with experience in libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, and PyTorch (or similar).
  • Solid understanding of machine learning and statistical modeling techniques.
  • Good understanding of risk management principles and portfolio optimization.
  • Fluency in verbal and written English.


Offered

  • Aggressive compensation package, including top-line performance-based bonuses. Full benefits package.
  • A culture of innovation and collaboration in a supportive team environment.
  • Access to cutting-edge technology and data resources and significant capital.
  • Opportunities for professional development and growth. Strong potential to progress to running and managing risk in the future.
  • Visa and Relocation to Switzerland.

Our client is a global commodities firm, and their trading branch is looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join their team focused on analytics, backtesting, and trading strategy optimisation. This role is central to the development of bespoke quantitative models and tools that support derivatives structuring, hedging, and trading.
Develop and implement quantitative models and analytics tools to enhance trading strategies.
Conduct in-depth data analysis and backtesting to support decision-making in derivatives and hedging strategies.
Collaborate with traders and data engineers to integrate advanced analytics into the trading workflow.
Use programming languages like Rust, R, Python, C++ and C# to develop efficient solutions.
Provide insights into market trends, risk factors, and pricing to optimise performance.
Strong foundation in quantitative modelling, data analysis, and financial engineering.
Experience in commodities trading, risk management, or energy markets is highly desirable.
Proficiency in modern programming languages with a focus on Rust, Python, R, C#, and C++(a combination of Rust and R is highly desirable).
Familiarity with trading IT platforms and backtesting frameworks.
Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-disciplinary teams.

Quant Analyst ‚Äì Trading IT Platform

4125771857,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-m-f-d-renewable-energy-berlin-ger-or-baar-switz-at-goldenpeaks-capital-4125771857?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=B63nHat0A%2B9%2BP%2BGKZF9wZg%3D%3D&trackingId=4HrCvG98LM6tMXbcSG8CFA%3D%3D,"Analyst (m/f/d) - Renewable Energy, Berlin (Ger.) or Baar (Switz.)",GoldenPeaks Capital,"Baar, Zug, Switzerland","Company information:

GoldenPeaks Capital Trading is the commercial branch of GoldenPeaks Capital Holding, responsible for offtake structuring, Power Purchase Agreements‚Äô (PPA) negotiations and commercialization of renewable production.

GoldenPeaks Capital is one of the fastest-growing independent green power producers in Eastern Europe. Fundamental to our ongoing success is broad value chain integration and consolidation at GoldenPeaks Capital. This ensures continuous success in reaching ambitious targets, due to a unique alignment of vision, planning and know-how.

We strive to promote renewable energy by offering innovative technologic as well as commercial solutions. We are aiming to develop, invest, build, and maintain our own large scale renewable power plants.

In the role as an Analyst, you will play a pivotal part in optimizing the company‚Äôs revenues by conducting market analysis, assessing risks, building market intelligence, and developing strategies and products to manage the portfolio and exposures effectively. You will leverage your analytical skills, attention to detail, and technical expertise to provide actionable insights. Collaboration with Portfolio Management, Origination, and external counterparties will be essential to your success.
Responsibilites include (but are not limited to):
Evaluate new business cases, including implementing new technologies, entering new markets, and launching new products.
Build and maintain a market intelligence framework to support data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with Portfolio Management and Origination to identify, analyse, and implement opportunities to optimize risk-weighted revenues.
Monitor market developments and regulatory changes, reporting on potential impacts to the business.
Analyse and manage large datasets to uncover insights and drive enhanced decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain tools or models using programming languages like Python for business analysis.
Design and manage database queries and operations
column2: experience with SQL or Azure platforms is a strong advantage.

column1: Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or higher) in economics, finance, engineering, computer science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in an analytical and/or business development role, ideally in the energy industry.
Commercial mindset with strong analytical and attention-to-detail skills.
Experience in working with big data operations and programming (Excel & Python preferred).
Critical thinking and the ability to work independently, taking ownership of tasks and initiatives.
Familiarity with database management tools such as SQL or Azure.
Proven ability to develop tools or models for business analysis.
Knowledge of energy markets and regulatory frameworks.
Berlin as a location would be preferred, but Baar, Switzerland would also be possible
Strategic Impact: Be a key player in shaping the company‚Äôs strategic decisions and driving its growth in dynamic markets.
Attractive (discretionary) bonus schemes to reward exceptional contributions.
Opportunity to work in an international, collaborative, and high-performing team.
Fast decision-making processes with direct feedback and the chance to see the tangible impact of your work.
Office centrally located (and easily reachable) at the Potsdamer Platz
Fast-paced and dynamic environment where the learning curve is high
Boosting your overall health in form of fresh fruits, healthy snacks, coffee and tea
